review_text:
Laura was an absolutely amazing host; she was available and responsive to any needs that cropped up.
The cottage and surrounding area are absolutely beautiful!
Our family really enjoyed our getaway in the mountains!
Knoebels, Pioneer tunnel, and Jim Thorpe along with the Lehigh Gorge Scenic Railway we’re all fantastic places- all within 40 minutes or less of the cottage; we had so many activities planned that we didn’t get to visit the fossil park, reptile park or deer farm this time around!
Laura has two sit-on-top kayaks available for use in what locals call “Moon Lake.”
The lake, as listed, really is more like a large pond; it’s recently been drained, but is still very usable and scenic. There’s fish and tons of wildlife going on during all hours- it was a treat to watch from the back deck.
Baggo/corn hole, rockers, multiple seating areas as well as a solo stove are also provided; all wonderful additions that add to the experience.
The fireplace in the main living area is stunning, and the furniture in this room is actually quite comfortable for an AirBnB listing; it really feels like home.
Books and games are available on the shelf for use, and pamphlets for local places of interest are available in a basket as well.
The entire cottage was absolutely spotless upon arrival, and the oil diffusers were a great addition.
There’s a smart TV and internet access, along with a DVD player all available for use.
The AC is in great working order and is located in the main living area and kitchen; it is run by remote. It’s helpful to know that the remote comes down from the holders and worked best when aimed directly at each unit. The only down side to the AC was that the bedroom doors must remain open for the air to get in, thus cutting down on privacy.
The bedrooms themselves were small, but functional for a small family getaway. The accordion doors provided little to no privacy, and the first bedroom door was broken upon arrival and never fully shut.
The bed in the second bedroom was comfortable, but the bed frame, while new, was broken up arrival as well; for full transparency- Laura did offer to fix this during our stay and we did decline. The frame itself in this room is not quality. The lack of a carpet in the room also allows the bed to shift with typical use which may have been the problem to begin with.
The neighboring home next door has a motion activated flood light aimed right at Laura’s cottage and kept us up the first night; we bought sleep masks and we were fine after. This light absolute pours into the bedrooms; room darkening shades and curtains would help this area tremendously.
The kitchen is a more adequately stocked than the listing gives itself credit for. Plenty of items for use along with fully stocked bins of coffee!
All of the house info can be found on the side of the fridge, along with menus of local places to eat at/order from.
The only issue we had with the kitchen was that the stove was not functioning and we were not notified prior to arrival; we spent a bit more than planned eating out and carried our store bought groceries for dinners home. with us.
The bathroom is equipped with a full washer and dryer, and the hot water never seems to run out. The bathroom was fully stocked and the water pressure was great! The bathroom door could use some attention, but with some care you can close the door.
The front door feels secure and the check in/out process is super easy; the digit locks and alarm make the home feel super safe.
The driveway is crushed stone and has room for two vehicles parked in a row; we recommend backing in. The road is a 35 mph zone, but the locals seem to do 60; the trees that are at the edge of the driveway provide some privacy for the home, but block views of the street as you pull out.
While the door and bed were minor issues experienced- it’s not something that can’t be fixed. We had a wonderful stay and look forward to a return trip soon.

The home was exactly as described, well-decorated, and very well stocked! Lots of natural light with windows across the back of the house, overlooking the lake. Excellent outside spaces with a covered porch and patio with a fire pit lakeside with Adirondack chairs and a table and chairs to take your dinner outside. Laura's house sits high on a hill overlooking the lake, so the view is lovely. There is also a grill on the patio. We took advantage of the kayaks and spent some time on the lake. The lake is small and shallow but perfect for lazing around in a kayak.
The bedroom we slept in faced the lake with sliding glass doors, allowing for pleasant morning light and views of the lake from the bed. The second bedroom does not have a view, but perfectly adequate for sleeping. The living room has a working fireplace (which we lit the first night) and very comfortable seating. Wood for both the fireplace and fit pit was plentifully stocked around the property.
The bathroom was well-stocked and also included a washer and dryer. Shower was comfortable. The kitchen had everything you needed to construct meals at the house and some pantry items at your disposal should you need.
The house was about 20 minutes from Pottsville, where the race was. We stopped at Boyer's Food Market for supplies for Saturday dinner. A few food/beverage highlights from the area were Pilger Ruh Brewing in Pottsville and The Little Brown Barrel in Minersville.
We would 100% return to Laura's house in the future. Perfect for a lazy weekend getaway on a lake.

The best parts about this rental might be the updated HVAC system and modern plumbing. It was cold and blustery outside but warm and comfy in the apartment. The water was hot and water pressure awesome. This is an old building so you can tell it had been completely updated. Also nice fast WiFi and multiple places to charge phone and laptop.

It’s easy walking distance to mostly all of Frackville and all of my relatives. If you forget anything Family Dollar is a 2 minute walk away. This end of town is looking a little shabby but inside the apartment is like a whole different world.
Thanks Lisa for a nice stay I hope to be back again!

This is a clean and very special, beautiful historical lodging that's been tastefully renovated. My husband and I were comfortable and able to relax for the last night of our long trip. The living room and kitchen area had everything we needed. Love the original artwork!
The bed was comfy. We're always grateful for a king-size bed, which the loft has. We're medium-size people who can't share anything smaller as we're very light sleepers.
If you, too, are a light sleeper, I recommend bringing a white noise fan (we travel with two, which we ran). The awesomeness of the town-center location means street noise is audible from the bedroom. Fortunately, it's a relatively quiet town. On the Saturday night we were there, things quieted down early, and the last gunning car engine of the night happened just after we turned off the lights.
If light interferes with your sleep, bring a sleep mask. The bedroom does not get completely dark with all the curtains pulled closed.
The town seemed worth taking time to explore. We wished could have arrived earlier, toured the Yuengling brewery, and taken the self-guided walk around town our hosts left us a map for.
